customer feedback containers have been one of those technologies that's allowed organizations to package applications
that's code into a single object and quickly deploy the same application to all your different operating
environments anyone who's ever worked with application development and rolling out releases understands the pain of
trying to keep dependencies applications and configuration consistent with
containers you get the exact same object throughout the development pipeline from build tests to production because of
this you are able to deploy faster knowing that you haven't introduced bugs caused by inconsistent operating
environments such as different OSS different versions of libraries and even differences in configuration containers
also make it easier to move from legacy to modern application most legacy applications can be packaged
into a docker file which can then be deployed to a container orchestration service such as Amazon ECS or Amazon eks
this basically gives you a path to modernization without requiring a big bang approach here are some of the
benefits of containers you get the ability to define your application as code using it frameworks such as docker
a developer can package their application in dependencies into a single object that can be ran anywhere
containers are supported it's also easier to manage applications built as
micro services as this allows you to scale and segregate your application into different areas and concern doing
this also reduces complexity and allows developers to focus on features and functionality as well as limiting blast
radius of breaking changes with containers as a single object testing
and deployments become much easier as there's no longer a series of artifacts the single object can also be used in
all environments even now even on a desktop this reduces the number of variables that change in any giving
release and makes it easier to troubleshoot if something happens to go wrong monitoring is even easier on
containers as well as you don't have to account for the differences in operating environments one of the tenets of
containers is keeping a consistent implementation model going from development testing staging and
eventually into production additionally container orchestration services such as Amazon ECS Amazon eks
have strong integration with Amazon CloudWatch and Amazon x-ray which
further enables easier monitoring and application level metrics and lastly if
